column5: Good work environments help mental health, but poor ones—like those with discrimination or high stress—can make it worse. In 2019, 15% of working-age adults had a mental health disorder, and globally, depression and anxiety cost $1 trillion in lost productivity each year. Governments and employers can improve mental health at work by creating supportive environments, offering training, and ensuring workers with mental health conditions are included and protected.
column6: World Health Organization: 5 Key Facts About Mental Health And Productivity
column8: Taking care of mental health at work is no longer optional — it’s essential. Every year, over 12 billion workdays are lost due to mental illness, costing companies both time and money. By creating a supportive environment, offering flexibility, and encouraging open conversations, businesses can help employees thrive and improve overall productivity.
column9: Why Supporting Mental Health at Work is Key to Success
column11: Workers are facing high levels of stress, anxiety, and depression due to global issues like the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change. Supervisors can play a key role in protecting employee mental health by offering emotional support, recognizing warning signs, and reducing stigma at work. Studies show that strong social connections at work are as important to our health as quitting smoking, making supportive supervisors essential for a healthier workplace.

column14: The global mental health technology market is growing fast, expected to jump from $8.9 billion in 2023 to $43.9 billion by 2033. This growth is driven by the rising demand for digital tools like teletherapy apps and AI chatbots, making mental health support more accessible. North America leads the way, but Europe is catching up, with both regions seeing more people using these technologies for self-care and therapy .

column20: Stress is a big issue, but technology is helping workers handle it better. Apps like Calm and devices like Apple Watch give employees easy access to tools for managing stress and improving mental health. Although challenges like data privacy remain, the future looks promising as new technologies like AI and virtual reality could provide even more personalized support for workplace well-being.

column23: Maintaining mental health for your employees has never been more crucial. With increasing pressures, evolving work environments, and the challenges of balancing personal and professional lives, mental well-being can easily take a back seat. Yet, when employees thrive mentally, productivity soars, creativity flourishes, and workplace culture strengthens.
